name: Security Rule
description: Establishes standards and procedures for protecting Electronic Protected Health Information (ePHI). Requires administrative, physical, and technical safeguards to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

name: Administrative Safeguards
description: Policies, procedures, and processes to prevent unauthorized access, use, and disclosure of ePHI. Includes security management process, assigned security responsibility, and workforce security measures.

name: Security Management Process
description: Comprehensive process to identify risks and vulnerabilities, implement safeguards, monitor safeguard effectiveness, and manage risks. Must include risk assessment and risk management.

name: Assigned Security Responsibility
description: Designation of individual responsible for developing and implementing security policies and procedures. Security officer must report to senior management.

name: Workforce Security
description: Policies and procedures to ensure only authorized individuals have access to ePHI. Includes user identification, emergency access procedures, and termination procedures.

name: Information Access Management
description: Policies and procedures for granting access to ePHI based on role, need-to-know, and job responsibilities. Includes access authorization and access establishment/modification procedures.

name: Security Awareness and Training
description: Mandatory security training for all workforce members who access ePHI. Training must cover security policies, password management, and reporting security incidents.

name: Security Incident Procedures
description: Policies and procedures to address security incidents including detection, documentation, mitigation, and corrective action. Must identify and log security incidents.

name: Contingency Planning
description: Policies and procedures to respond to and recover from disruptions to ePHI availability. Includes backup procedures, disaster recovery planning, and emergency operations procedures.

name: Business Associate Agreements
description: Policies and procedures requiring business associates and subcontractors to implement HIPAA safeguards. Must have written agreements in place before accessing ePHI.

name: Physical Safeguards
description: Physical measures, policies, and procedures to protect facilities, buildings, and equipment from unauthorized access and environmental threats that could affect ePHI.

name: Facility Access Controls
description: Policies and procedures to control and manage physical access to facilities containing ePHI. Includes visitor management, surveillance, and physical barriers.

name: Workstation Security
description: Physical safeguards for computers and electronic devices containing ePHI. Includes physical controls, environmental protections, and equipment placement restrictions.

name: Workstation Use Policies
description: Policies and procedures for proper use of workstations and devices accessing ePHI. Includes screen position controls, monitoring for unauthorized access, and login restrictions.

name: Device and Media Controls
description: Policies and procedures for management of physical devices and media containing ePHI. Includes disposal, movement tracking, and reuse procedures.

name: Technical Safeguards
description: Technology-based measures to protect ePHI and control its use. Includes access controls, encryption, audit logging, integrity controls, and transmission security.

name: Access Controls
description: Technical policies and procedures to control access to ePHI systems. Includes unique user identification, emergency access procedures, encryption, and decryption mechanisms.

name: Audit Controls and Logs
description: Mechanisms to record and examine activity containing or affecting ePHI. Must maintain audit logs for minimum 6 years. Includes review procedures and incident tracking.

name: Integrity Controls
description: Mechanisms to verify that ePHI has not been altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner. Includes digital signatures, message authentication codes, and checksums.

name: Transmission Security
description: Technology safeguards to guard against ePHI transmission interception. Includes encryption, virtual private networks (VPN), TLS, and secure protocols for internal/external transmission.

name: OCR Security Enforcement
description: HHS Office for Civil Rights (OCR) enforces the Security Rule through investigation of complaints, audits, and assessment of civil penalties for violations.

name: Risk Assessment and Management
description: Continuous process to identify potential risks and vulnerabilities affecting ePHI. Must include periodic risk assessments (at least annually), documentation, and remediation of identified risks.
